subject: Pedal hub PCB short circuiting USB ports.
description_text:
Hello Support team,

I ordered the Simsonn Pedal Pro X Ultra on November 2nd last year and they
have been working fine until last week, when out of nowhere while
sim racing all the devices that were connected to my pc (including the
pedals) suddenly disconnected with a windows notification that a short
circuit had been detected on the usb ports. The safety feature of my
motherboard shut off the usb ports until the defective device (which turned
out to be the pedals) had been disconnected and the pc restarted.

The problem kept persisting everytime i plugged the cable from the "pc usb"
port on the pedal hub into my pc. I bought a new USB A to USB B cable which
didn't fix it and I also bought an external powered usb hub, both of which
didn't fix it. After disconnecting the pedals from the pedal hub, the hub
still kept causing a short circuit while being the only thing plugged in.
The pedals, cables, pedal box and PCB inside look fine visually. I think
that the pedal hub is still the problem here. How are you guys able to
assist me with this issue? Should I send the pedal box back to you? Or the
whole set including the pedals, just in case?

I'm looking forward to hearing from you.

Daniel Woerde

Order:
#SSN3192

conversations.body_text: Hello support team,     Could someone look into this, please?     Thanks,  Daniel

Hi D. W.,     If the pedal controller box is connected directly to a rear USB 3.0 (blue) port on your PC and the short-circuit issue still occurs, this indicates a fault with the controller box. In this case, we will send you a replacement controller box.

Hi support team,

I reconnected the pedal box for confirmation if it’s indeed broken but when
doing so, the USB overcurrent fault is consistently triggered now when the
brake pedal is connected, the throttle pedal doesn’t short the usb but
windows does give me a notification that the connected usb device
malfunctions and isn’t recognized. After this event the pedal control box
becomes unstable even without pedals attached. That’s why i thought the
pedal box shorts with nothing attached.

Would it also be an option to get the whole set replaced, or do you guys
think that it’s still a problem with the controller box?

On Wed, 7 Jan 2026 at 09:30, service@simsonn.com
Hello support team,     Could someone get back to me on this?     Thanks
Hi D. W.,       We can send you a brand-new ProX Ultra control box as a replacement—would that be okay?

Hi support team,

That would be great! Is there anyway on how to avoid this in the future? or
is this just an unfortunate malfunction?

On Fri, 9 Jan 2026 at 04:42, service@simsonn.com

Hi support team,

Has the control box been sent out? And if so, what’s the ETA on when it
will be delivered?
Hello support team,     Could someone get back to me on this? Sorry for being so persistent, i just really want to get back to racing.     Thanks
